message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a computational trust model that is inspired by stereotypes used in real-life. It focuses on how agents derive trust when facing a stranger, and how they aggregate stereotypes matching the stranger's profile. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including social and information networks (cs.SI), cybernetics (cs.CY), cryptography and security (cs.CR), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), and information retrieval (cs.IR).
